docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 6 -- The United Nations General Assembly, which convened here Sept. 21, decided today to adjourn Saturday night or early Sunday morning and resume its work in Flushing Meadow on April 1.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 6 -- The United Nations General Assembly, which convened here Sept. 21, decided today to adjourn Saturday night or early Sunday morning and resume its work in Flushing Meadow on April 1.
docs.abstract: Assembly votes 43-13 to adjourn Dec 12 and resume session April 1; Argentina amends US plea for Feb 1 resumption; Brit plan to extend current session defeated; agenda wrangle noted; resolution text

headline.main: U.N. TO RECONVENE AT FLUSHING APR. 1; TO HALT SATURDAY; General Assembly Approves U.S. Resolution to Divide Session Into Two Parts

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 8 -- The United Nations General Assembly decided this morning to postpone consideration of the question of the former Italian colonies until it resumes its meeting at Flushing Meadow April 1. The Assembly voted 31 to 11, with 9...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 8 -- The United Nations General Assembly decided this morning to postpone consideration of the question of the former Italian colonies until it resumes its meeting at Flushing Meadow April 1. The Assembly voted 31 to 11, with 9 abstentions, to reject a proposal that the question be transferred from the over crowded Political and Security Committee to the ad hoc committee that was established a few weeks ago.

headline.main: U.N. DELAYS ACTION ON ROME COLONIES; Assembly Votes, 31 to 11, to Put Off Debate Until April Italians Pleased by Move

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Sunday, Dec. 12 -- The United Nations General Assembly, which had set up late yesterday a Conciliation Commission to attempt to work out a permanent settlement in Palestine, early today named the United States, France and Turkey to the...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Sunday, Dec. 12 -- The United Nations General Assembly, which had set up late yesterday a Conciliation Commission to attempt to work out a permanent settlement in Palestine, early today named the United States, France and Turkey to the Commission.

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 11 -- Plenipotentiaries of twenty countries subscribed to the newly completed convention outlawing genocide when it was opened for signature here this afternoon.

headline.main: 20 COUNTRIES SIGN PACT ON GENOCIDE; Evatt's Name First on U.N. Document -- Mrs. Roosevelt Hails Rights Declaration

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 -- Members of the Council of the Organization of American States voted at a special meeting tonight to ask their Foreign Ministers for instructions on the question whether they should serve as a provisional council of consultation...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 12 -- Members of the Council of the Organization of American States voted at a special meeting tonight to ask their Foreign Ministers for instructions on the question whether they should serve as a provisional council of consultation in the situation created by the reported crossing of the Costa Rican border by armed forces from Nicaragua.
docs.abstract: Amer States Organization Council meets; votes to ask Foreign Mins instruction to act as provisional council under Rio pact rules; Nicaragua objects to Council action; Esquivel and CR reprs illus

headline.main: COSTA RICAN ISSUE GIVEN TO AMERICAS BY STATES' COUNCIL; Special Meeting in Washington Recesses Till Tomorrow for Foreign Offices' Orders NICARAGUA DENIES ROLE Rio Accord Empowers Nations to Break With Managua if It Threatens the Peace COSTA RICAN ISSUE GIVEN TO AMERICAS

byline.original: By BERTRAM D. HULENSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: It was another week of unimportant price changes and business in the foreign exchange market, something of the pattern that has been ruling for the last month. Trading opinion for the slack was mixed, some being inclined to the belief that year-end...
docs.lead_paragraph: It was another week of unimportant price changes and business in the foreign exchange market, something of the pattern that has been ruling for the last month. Trading opinion for the slack was mixed, some being inclined to the belief that year-end accounts have largely been taken care of, while others pointed to the irregularly lower trend of stocks and commodities, and the slowness of capital payments.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 -- The American republics that are party to the Rio de Janeiro Treaty of Mutual Defense for the Western Hemisphere tonight invoked that pact in the situation created by the reported invasion of Costa Rica by an armed force from...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14 -- The American republics that are party to the Rio de Janeiro Treaty of Mutual Defense for the Western Hemisphere tonight invoked that pact in the situation created by the reported invasion of Costa Rica by an armed force from Nicaragua.
